Some traffic in other drugs like methamphetamine and cocaine, but authorities believe public land pot farming is their bread and butter.
And the activity has become widespread.
Last year, 560,000 marijuana plants were eradicated from national forest lands in California alone.
Experts on drug policy and drug cartels are not surprised.

Jimenez points to painstaking investigations over the last six years that have placed dozens of upper-level traffickers and a handful of leaders behind bars.
